properties.areaDesc: Michigan City IN to New Buffalo MI; New Buffalo MI to St Joseph MI
properties.headline: Heavy Freezing Spray Warning issued January 18 at 4:37AM EST until January 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Northern Indiana
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a
Heavy Freezing Spray Warning, which is in effect from 4 PM this
afternoon to 7 PM EST Sunday. The Heavy Freezing Spray Watch is
no longer in effect.

* WINDS...South 20 to 30 knots with gusts to 35 knot gales early
Saturday. Winds veer west to 30 knots by midday Saturday with
gusts up to 40 knot gales continuing through early Sunday
morning.

* WAVES...Waves build to 8 to 14 feet occasionally 18 feet on
Saturday and persist into Sunday morning.

* FREEZING SPRAY...Ice may rapidly accumulate on decks and
superstructures which could result in a loss of vessel
stability.

* ICE ACCUMULATIONS...At a rate of 2 centimeters per hour or more.
properties.instruction:
A Heavy Freezing Spray Warning means heavy freezing spray is
expected to rapidly accumulate on vessels. These conditions can
be extremely hazardous to navigation. It is recommended that
mariners not trained to operate in these conditions or vessels
not properly equipped to do so...remain in port or avoid the
waring area.

A Gale Warning means winds of 34 to 47 knots are imminent or
occuring. Operating a vessel in gale conditions requires
experience and properly equipped vessels. It is highly
recommended that mariners without the proper experience seek safe
harbor prior to the onset of gale conditions.

NWSheadline: GALE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY... ...HEAVY FREEZING SPRAY WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM EST SUNDAY
